intro: Carex pagesii, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, rushes, and other grass-like plants. This plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spikelets. Carex pagesii plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
